title: Polls

properties.name: description
properties.value: Polls are in-game votes in which players are asked to express their preferences for certain changes within Old School RuneScape. Only members with a total level of 300 or above and with a minimum total play-time of 25 hours can participate.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Polls
A graph displaying the voter participation in each poll.

Polls are in-game votes in which players are asked to express their preferences for certain changes within Old School RuneScape. Only members with a total level of 300 or above and with a minimum total play-time of 25 hours can participate.

When a poll is live, players who log in and have not cast their votes will receive a message in the chatbox stating There's a poll running - head to the community section of the account management menu to cast your vote!. Poll booths will also have a small raised flag to indicate that the player has not yet voted, and the Account Management Community tab will indicate that a poll is active, letting players vote from the tab.

Originally, polls were only held on the official Old School RuneScape website. Following the results of the Old School in-game poll survey, it was decided to add in-game poll booths. Players can no longer vote on the official website.

Polls on game updates use a plurality voting system to determine their outcome. Any question containing a Yes option requires a supermajority of 75% of the total votes to pass. This is not counting Skip question votes, an option introduced following the results of the Quality of Life - Top 10 Skilling Suggestions poll.

Example of a running poll in a poll booth.
Example of running poll questions prior to the integrity update that hid active poll results. Passing questions were coloured green; failing questions were uncoloured.

Placed votes cannot be changed, and every question must be answered to vote. A running tally could previously be found during polls at poll booths or on the official website. These and other aspects related to polling itself have also been subject of polls, but have historically failed to pass. Beginning 12 April 2019, all poll results are now hidden before the poll ends as part of a game integrity update.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
12 September 2019
(update) 		Mobile

The vertical size of the voting buttons on mobile have been increased by 60%.

12 April 2019

All poll results are now hidden before the poll ends as part of a game integrity update.

11 February 2016
(update | poll)

The option to skip questions is now available.

11 September 2014
(update)

Poll results page are now optimized for multiple answer questions.

21 August 2014
(update | poll)

In-game polling booths are now available around Gielinor. Previously, polls could only be accessed through the website.

rawContent:
{{External|rs}}
[[File:Poll icon.png|left|150px]]
[[File:Voter participation in polls.png|thumb|300px|A graph displaying the voter participation in each poll.]]
'''Polls''' are in-game {{wp|Voting|votes}} in which [[Account|players]] are asked to express their preferences for certain changes within ''[[Old School RuneScape]]''. Only [[member]]s with a [[total level]] of 300 or above and with a minimum total play-time of 25 hours can participate.

When a poll is live, players who log in and have not cast their votes will receive a message in the chatbox stating ''{{RSFont|colour=#7f00ff|There's a poll running - head to the community section of the account management menu to cast your vote!}}''. [[Poll booth]]s will also have a small raised flag to indicate that the player has not yet voted, and the [[Account Management]] Community tab will indicate that a poll is active, letting players vote from the tab.

Originally, polls were only held on the official ''Old School RuneScape'' website. Following the results of the ''[[Poll:Old School in-game poll survey|Old School in-game poll survey]]'', it was decided to add in-game [[poll booth]]s. Players can no longer vote on the official website.

Polls on game [[updates]] use a {{wp|plurality voting system}} to determine their outcome. Any question containing a ''Yes'' option requires a {{wp|supermajority}} of 75% of the total votes to pass. This is not counting ''Skip question'' votes, an option introduced following the results of the ''[[Poll:Quality of Life - Top 10 Skilling Suggestions|Quality of Life - Top 10 Skilling Suggestions]]'' poll.
[[File:Polls interface.png|thumb|left|150px|Example of a running poll in a poll booth.]]
[[File:Poll Result Pre-Hiding.png|thumb|right|150px|Example of running poll questions prior to the integrity update that hid active poll results. Passing questions were coloured green; failing questions were uncoloured.]]
Placed votes cannot be changed, and every question must be answered to vote. A running tally could previously be found during polls at poll booths or on the official website. These and other aspects related to polling itself have also been subject of polls, but have historically failed to pass. Beginning 12 April 2019, all poll results are now hidden before the poll ends as part of a [[game integrity update]].
{{Clear|left}}

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 12 September 2019
|update = POH Board and PvP Balancing
|type = mobile
|change = The vertical size of the voting buttons on mobile have been increased by 60%.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 12 April 2019
|change = All poll results are now hidden before the poll ends as part of a [[game integrity update]].
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 11 February 2016
|update = Tournament Stats & Skilling QoL
|poll = Quality of Life - Top 10 Skilling Suggestions
|change = The option to skip questions is now available.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 11 September 2014
|update = Optional Randoms & Goblins
|change = Poll results page are now optimized for multiple answer questions.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 21 August 2014
|update = In-Game Polls & Pet Insurance
|poll = Old School feature poll - Content Poll 23
|change = In-game polling booths are now available around Gielinor. Previously, polls could only be accessed through the website.
}}
{{Subject changes footer}}
